value.title: German Court Says Tesla Self-Driving Claims Are Misleading
value.excerpt: Tesla’s plans to steal buyers from German luxury automakers suffered a setback Tuesday after a court in Munich ruled that the California maker of electric cars made exaggerated promises about its autonomous driving technology.

value.title: AI startup Abacus goes live with commercial deep learning service, takes $13M Series A financing
value.excerpt: With $18.25 million in venture capital money from Eric Schmidt, Jerry Yang, and other luminaries, Abacus Tuesday opened its deep learning service for general customer availability, with the intent of making it easy for companies to customize and scale AI in the cloud.

value.title: Microsoft’s SoftNER AI uses unsupervised learning to help triage cloud service outages
value.excerpt: In a new paper, Microsoft researchers detail an AI system that parses cloud service interruption incident descriptions to help with triaging.

value.title: Should Robots Pay Taxes?
value.excerpt: Federal taxes are due this week in the US. But what about our synthetic coworkers? Should they cough up, too? Jordan Harrod, a Harvard-MIT PhD student, has something to say on the subject.

value.title: BAE Systems’ MindfuL Technology to Provide Transparency and Build User Trust in Machine Learning Systems
value.excerpt: BAE Systems recently delivered software to the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) as part of a contract under the agency’s Competency-Aware Machine Learning (CAML) program. The delivery of the MindfuL TM software is the first milestone in the program to improve the transparency of machine learning systems.
